required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilates Pelvic Floor Strengthening Program to Improve Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: HLP-16-003H: Does a Twice Weekly, 12-week Pilates Pelvic Floor Strengthening Program Improve Short- and Long-term Measures of Stress Urinary Incontinence Symptoms in Women Ages 45-70 Years of Age.

brief_summary.textblock: Does a twice weekly, 12-week Pilates pelvic floor strengthening program improve short- and long-term measures of stress urinary incontinence symptoms in women ages 45-70 years of age?

primary_outcome.measure: Change in score on International Consultation on Incontinence (ICIQ-UI Short Form)
primary_outcome.description: The ICIQ-UI Short Form consists of 3 questions. The ICIQ score is a sum of the responses to the 3 questions with a total possible range of 0 (none) to 21 (all the time/a great deal).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in score on Medical, Epidemiological, Social Aging (MESA) Urinary Incontinence Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The MESA Urinary Incontinence Questionnaire consists of 3 sections: General questions (unscored), Urge Incontinence (6 questions), and Stress Incontinence (9 questions). The scored questions can range from 0 (never) to 3 (often). The score for the Urge Incontinence is the sum of the responses/18, and the score for the Stress Incontinence section is the sum of the responses/27.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in score on Linear Analogue Self Assessment (LASA)
secondary_outcome.description: The LASA questionnaire consists of 6 questions, each ranging from 0 (as bad as it can be) to 10 (as good as it can be). Therefore, the total possible scores would range from 0 (as bad as it can be) to 60 (as good as it can be).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 45-70 years of age.
2. Able to provide informed consent.
3. Able to lower and rise from the floor safely and independently.
4. Anticipated to be able to attend at least 9 of the first 12 classes (75%) in weeks 1-6.
5. Anticipated to be able to attend at least 9 of the final 12 classes (75%) in weeks 7-12.
6. Score of 6+ on ICIQ-UI Short Form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy
2. Unable to speak and comprehend English
3. Chronic neurologic condition (e.g., Parkinson's or Multiple Sclerosis) that impacts bladder function.

responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, Associate Professor of Medicine, College of Medicine
